The hotel is convenient to downtown attractions such as the Staples center, museums, concert halls, etc. We enjoyed our stay very much and look forward to returning. If you like a historic hotel with character this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place to stay in Los Angeles! Overpriced and over-rated!”
Reviews.Author: azroxie
Reviews.Content: -$40 for Valet Parking or $30 for a private parking garage around the corner, next to Dominoes Pizza. RIP-OFF! -$10 for wi-fi. RIP-OFF! -Comfy bed, pretty decor, good water pressure. Weird toilet in bathroom...no toilet tank, looks like public restroom toilet. -Semi-friendly staff. Sometimes, they spoke like cordial robots...they WON'T guarantee a room with two-beds either. -Gift shop with over-priced items...about $3 for a bottle of soda. RIP-OFF! -Beautiful lobby. -Paper-thin walls/doors (heard loud teens from a Church Dance group slamming doors all night long...even after midnight!!!! Had to call security twice to STOP this!) -Stain on furniture. -Central air...the one in room doesn't truly control the individual room temperature. Says A/C, but was blasting heat into the room like a giant hair dryer. -On 11th Floor, could still hear traffic outside below. -The halls smell "vintage"...or maybe it was cigarette smoke? -Elevators take FOREVER, esp when you are stuck getting a room at a higher level. The elevators would stop at EVERY floor most of the time even though no one was on the floors it stopped at...creepy! -Bathroom had a shower cap, stinky lotion, shampoo, conditioner, and shower gel, plus 2 bars of soap. No counter space for toiletries. -Dodge wandering shower curtain in shower...it will stick to you like a dryer fabric sheet.. -Good Kleenex brand of tissue. Better quality of toilet paper in bathroom than most hotels have...a BONUS! -I would NEVER stay here again, nor would I recommend it to anyone. Find a different place, if you want a decent night's sleep. This place is the WORST place I have ever stayed at!

Reviews.Title: “i dont like!”
Reviews.Author: nikolaoug
Reviews.Content: was expensive in term of quality!the parking costing 40 $ per day!the room was clean byt there was mold in the bathroom.the area around the hotel was not very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrmull
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to downtown Los Angeles frequently to attend concerts at the Walt Disney Hall on Grand Avenue. Our hotel of choice during these visits is the Omni, just a short walk away, but the Omni was booked both times we attended events in January. Our backup was the Biltmore, where we had never stayed before. We were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is beautiful with lots of history. All of the public areas are magnificent, with high ceilings and lovely architecture. The hotel prides itself on its history and displays many old photographs of Hollywood stars attending events at the hotel over the years, including the Academy of Awards. If you are a lover of gracious, old hotels, this is a great place to stay. We stayed on the Club level and the rooms were nice. The bathrooms, however, are tiny (in the style of old hotel bathrooms) and really not big enough for two people. The Club lounge was also pleasant but we found the offerings there to be less than the Omni Club lounge. We only ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant and found it more than adequate--the buffet is quite good. The walk to the Disney Hall from the Biltmore is about two blocks longer than from the Omni with a very steep hill to climb. We will go back to the Omni in March when we return to LA but the Biltmore is a good backup if the Omni is full.

Reviews.Title: “Old World charm”
Reviews.Author: drviljoen
Reviews.Content: As every other reviewer is pointing out! The arrival seems to be spectacular due to the impressive foyer and restaurant. It is truly old world and beautifully done. You need a car when you stay at the hotel over a weekend as down town LA is very quiet during that time, and public transport is not frequent. The shopping malls around the hotel is closed on sundays and the nearest shopping mall seems to be The Grove (plus minus 10 miles away). The food in the hotel is expensive and not very noteworthy. The hotel might be ideal for the businessman doing business down town LA. Not really for the holiday traveller!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice lobby , but the rooms needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: BugsbunnyRO
Reviews.Content: Well the location of the hotel is good . Right in the city center . The lobby is fantastic . You get the feeling of very stylish hotel . Nice cages and a good bar full of people every night . The only dissapoinment were the rooms , which are old decorated and the furniture is old . The baths are bad as well . The rooms needs urgent renovation . We also upgraded the room , but the new one was the same only a little bigger .

Reviews.Title: “A good downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveller60859
Reviews.Content: The Millennium is a grand dame hotel, built in the 20s, and features very ornate interior design. It was THE hotel in the 20s, site of the first Academy Awards. The rooms are average sized, with relatively small bathrooms. The carpets need replacement in some areas, but it is clean and the staff is very friendly. The huge bar has many small table seating areas and expensive prices. There is a small bakery almost next door and a Starbucks a block away that opens at 5am. We went to the McCormick restaurant a block away and had an excellent meal. The tiny Hilton across the street features a very quiet bar and a nice sandwich menu.

Reviews.Title: “we were robbed at the biltmore - poor security, poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: karenterry
Reviews.Content: Our hotel room was broken into and cameras, netbook computer etc stolen along with all the photographs from our trip. Nothing was in a room safe because our room didn't have a safe! They initially mucked up our booking (made and paid for several months earlier) and shunted us to a room that appeared to be under renovation. Los Angeles Police told us inspection of the room lock revealed the burglary must have occurred while the maid was in the room - either she let someone in or left the room unattended. The hotel management couldn't have cared less - had to be pushed to move us to another room, then did not enquire after our welfare at all for the rest of our stay. In fact, they seemed highly suspicious of us. They do not respond to my numerous letters/emails sent since our return to Australia. I want to know the outcome of the investigation that they assured us would be ongoing, as I have been desperate to recover my memory stick containing all my photographs. I can only conclude they are afraid of being sued! Highly disappointing from a hotel of this calibre.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Decor - Friendly Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: nearingretirement
Reviews.Content: My wife booked this hotel as a short City break at the end of a trip taking in Vancouver, and Alaska down to San Diego. In my opinion it was a perfect choice, I had no idea of the history or reputation of The Biltmore and we were fascinated by the public areas and the connections with numerous films and the early years of the Academy Awards. The Staff were extremely helpful with every request that we made and gave us some very useful information and tips on getting around LA as well as a couple of brilliant local restaurants. It is ideally located near to the Metro which we found extremely economic and efficient (not to mention entertaining!!!) and enabled us to see far more of the LA area than we had anticipated we would be able to see, would definitely recommend the trip out to Long Beach on the Metro, you get to see a lot of ordinary LA on the way, it brings you back to the REAL world. The room we had was a little tired, but then it didn't cost a fortune to stay there, overall it was extremely good value and well situated for getting around. The bar had a great atmosphere, at the time we were there, there were several corporate events taking place, so the bar had a real buzz, (even though as an Englishman I do find it a little strange to see so many men drinking dubious coloured cocktails) but Hey Ho some at least were drinking beer. Would definitely stay there againif we come back to LA

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but strictly business area”
Reviews.Author: melissamazzei
Reviews.Content: The hotel was decorated very nicely. Clean and friendly. I checked in on a Sunday and wanted to get something to eat. There was only one bar and grill open. If you are not there for business, there is nothing to do.

Reviews.Title: “Old Style Hollywood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller008
Reviews.Content: The public spaces are in old hollywood style and gorgeous to pass through. All staff encountered were professional and courteous. Room was a good size and spotless. Fixtures, doorknobs, handles all seemed original, adding an aura of timelessness to the rooms, though the beds were new and comfortable. The shower/bathtub did drain very slowly and the hotel should probably look into refurbishing the bathrooms. There was a charge for internet service but it did work well. A minor issue was resolved with a quick call to reception. I believe rates for this hotel can vary widely and I would recommend this hotel if you can get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: zoozoezoo
Reviews.Content: My fiancée and I stayed here for three nights. The hotel has a beautiful lobby which really adds to its charm. The room was a nice size and clean, and the bed was very comfortable. It's true that SOME of the hardwear of the room (very old doors, very old TV) is in need of updating, but for the most part the decor in the room is similar to any average hotel. And it's obvious there is ongoing work to update what needs to be updated. I have mixed feelings about the location of the hotel. It's closeness to metro station was my main consideration. While it is very close to Pershing square station, Pershing square is not somewhere you want to be alone at if you are by yourself, especially at night. Having to cross Pershing square to go back to the hotel was causing a bit of stress during my stay. But then again, I would not say if was unsafe, but we were just uncomfortable. Using the metro to get around Hollywood and Universal studio was really convenient. We even used it to go to Little Tokyo. We didn't use the bus system, but on the 2 days that we utlitlized the subway system, it was very prompt and convenient. The estimated arrival time on the trains are shown on monitors along the tracks, and we never have to wait more than a few minutes for the train to arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice location, fun bar!”
Reviews.Author: GDC007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend and had a very nice time. The hotel has a lot of history and is well kept. The bar had live music friday and saturday and the bartender was friendly. The location, downtown, was for us, close enough to anything (metro, metro bus, staples center, starbucks!). The room was very comfortable, (921 i think) and room service was good as well as breakfast buffet. No complaints whatsoever!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Downtown -- and Nothing Else”
Reviews.Author: khg2010
Reviews.Content: For any downtown L.A.-focused trips, this is a great hotel. Historic, elegant, with full amenities. But if you want to see anything else in L.A., like Hollywood, the beaches, shopping meccas, etc., make sure you've got a car. Public transportation is spotty, and walking is limited. The hotel itself is lovely, as is the on-site bar. It doesn't seem well insulated from outside noise, but nothing happens downtown at night anyway, so it's not much of an issue. Beds and pillows are comfy and bathrooms are clean. Staff is very kind and helpful. You'll have to pay for internet, but I just go across the street to the fantastic public library and use their free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Rude reception tarnishes visit to Hollywood History.”
Reviews.Author: natalieinthefoam
Reviews.Content: I had long awaited our stay at the Biltmore. Our friend was flying in from Italy and it being his first trip to America, I did plenty of research in preparation for our visit. I feel I had very realistic expectations and was surprisingly let down pretty much immediately by the front desk staff. I am an experienced traveler and was shocked by how UNwelcoming the reception was, at the time we were their only customer at the counter and were made to feel like a bother AND that we did not have enough money to even be considered clientele for this establishment!!!!! (There was a glitch with one of the credit cards, but entirely because they were trying to charge $2000 over what the correct amount should have been!) In fact, this is the most unwelcome I have ever been made to feel at ANY hotel! My sister didn't even want to deal with them and was ready to go to a different hotel all together (but we stuck it out)! I tried asking a couple of questions about the history of the hotel and the receptionist I asked, just briefly glanced up and said she didn't know and couldn't help me! Her body language spoke volumes about how off-put she was! Working in public relations and customer service, I found the behavior appalling! Other staff at the Biltmore were amazing; housekeeping, door men, and the valets! The building itself is so much more than beautiful architecture, mouldings, painted ceilings, marble floors, and several chandeliered ballrooms . It's a magical palace filled with the stuff Hollywood history and it's dreams are made of! The expression, "If these walls could talk...", has never been more accurately used. I HIGHLY recommend visiting this historical monument, but hesitate in advising you to stay over night. Our room was clean, with mediocre furnishings, very comfortable beds, great sheets, and decent towels. I love the feeling of stepping back in time, however, since our room was modernized with a TV and wouldn't of had a TV in the room back in 1923, it's time to upgrade to flat screens. Also, save yourself $40 a day on parking and park 2 blocks away at the Athena Parking Garage for around $10 a day. This hotel is not the best LA has to offer, so I don't know why they act like they are. Really, I am their demographic: someone who can appreciate and is interested in what historical value the Biltmore does have to offer. They were disappointing as a 4 star hotel but exceptional as a museum of politics, dreams, movies, craftsmanship, and great works of art. Furthermore, I will be staying at the Biltmore again but ONLY because it means so much to my Grandmother (who remembers the Biltmore from it's hay day). I pray the staff treat her like the queen she is! If it were up to me, we would probably be staying across the street at the Hilton. I'll be happy to help if any of you have questions!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful public spaces, disappointing rooms”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethHansen
Reviews.Content: I love the Biltmore's lobby, the Rendezvous Court, and Smeraldi's Restaurant. The Old World murals, gorgeous high ceilings with artistic wood and plaster work, and the traditional furnishings qualify this downtown Los Angeles gem as one of the world's great historic hotels. Having said that, I'm not sure I would stay there again. The night I checked in I couldn't make the TV work and called reception. They said they'd sent an engineer, but then called back to say it was the cable company's fault and they couldn't do anything about it. They were waiting for the cable company's visit "tomorrow." I also noticed some fairly obvious deferred maintainance in the room. For instance, the ornamental drape over the bed was held together by a plastic twist tie because the bracket intended for this purpose was broken. I also learned that none of the rooms in the hotel come with mini-fridges, and the in-room safe was useless because it was located on a high shelf in the closet that I could barely reach. The hotel does not have a spa, but does have a fitness center and an indoor pool. I should also mention that my room was on the more expensive Club Floor, but learned that the Club Lounge closes for several hours during the day and at 8pm every night. The staff in the Lounge were not helpful in anyway. The lounge offers one computer with Internet access, continental breakfast, and evening hors d'oevres. I mentioned to two different staff members that my room lacked a robe, slippers, and coffee maker and both of them told me to "call housekeeping." I've traveled enough to know that in a hotel with an attentive staff, they would have taken care of it themselves. Valet parking is $40 a day, which seems excessive, but really it was the staff attitude and the deferred maintainance that bothered me the most. Anyone who decides to stay here should know that room sizes vary widely. I saw a "standard room" on a lower floor that was twice the size of mine on the Club Floor (although it had the same small bathroom). I recommend specifying at the time of booking that you'd like one of the spacious rooms - whether Club Floor or Standard. The beds were very comfortable and the bed linens were high quality. The location is also convenient for attending events at the Walt Disney Concert Hall and the Music Centre. I'm just sorry that staff attitude was so poor. I wouldn't recommend the hotel to a friend for an overnight stay, but will continue to keep it on my list of must-see places in L. A. and no doubt will return for a meal or afternoon tea.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: cnunez
Reviews.Content: After making my reservations for this hotel I decided to check the ratings, and I must say, they made me very nervous. Some ratings were good, but I focused on the bad ones.I decided to keep my reservations mainly because of the good reputations I have heard of the hotel. I am so glad I didl. I loved the hotel and my children loved it too! We all agreed it felt like we were on the Titanic ship. It was so beautiful and elegant. The room was a good size and it was very clean, and I'm a clean freak! I can't wait to come back with my husband for a weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the film history and ambiance”
Reviews.Author: 1wabbit007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights back in April. Got a great deal for 3 people, room was huge, 2 lovely comfy beds, free internet in the lobby, v ery handy, found front desk staff on a whole very helpful, 1 or 2 grumpy but get that everywhere i think, gave me literature on all the film/shows that had been filmed at the hotel and i got great kick out of going through the list of them, one of the large function rooms was preparing for a fancy wedding and i peeked in, staff in there very welcoming, insisted i come in and take pictures which i thought was real nice. The swimming pool was small to what i am used to but still clean and acceptable. Very close to metro station and a good shopping centre practically around the corner. Abolutely loved the hotel lobby and any shows i see on the tv now i'm checking to see if filmed here.

Reviews.Title: “disapointing, could not wait to check out!”
Reviews.Author: ninapatel
Reviews.Content: The toilet bowl had a ring. There was mildew on the the tile in the tub. One could hear the laundry carts at 7 am. You could hear the people next door and the door closing everytime. Not many outlets in room. Poor lighting in room. Need a big mirror in room as there was only one that was behind the lamp on night stand. The bathroom was too cramped and the mirrors in there were useless.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Biltmore Doesn't Dissapoint”
Reviews.Author: lazymomma
Reviews.Content: During our time at the Biltmore we were surrounded by young, eager, hopeful candidates for the show America's Got Talent. Each hallway had some unthusiastic tenor belting out the refrains of their "winning audition" and the corridors were filled with young dancers, magicians and un-talented people! It was an amazing weekend with film crews and joyous shouting as some auditioner came out of the ballroom screaming "We're going to Vegas!"...I know this is not an every weekend feeling at the Biltmore, but I felt that we had stepped back into 1950 LA. The Biltmore boasts their rich history of famous stars and presidential pedigree and the making of a future star in our midst was the cherry on top. I would absolutely reccomend this hotel and encourage the guests to find a weekend when filming or something exciting is about to happen!

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: Tengak
Reviews.Content: Staff at all levels were excellent, can almost anticipate your need before you realise it. The older concierge, African American, was exceptional with his recommendations and detail directions as well as quiet efficiency and service with a smile. The room was dated but do exhibit the charm of the bygone era. The bathroom needs a bit more attention, towel rails were rusted at one corner and a tiny section of the grout was mouldy. The noise from the outside airconditioners was quite intrusive until you get used to it. The bedding was very comfortable giving a good night's sleep. It is only a block away from the Metro's Pershing Square station with access to the Red & Purple Lines. Therefore you can get to Hollywood, Universal Studios & Chinatown using public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Lower your expectations, but keep your wallet open”
Reviews.Author: ElsaInCA
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I booked the hotel because it was listed as a host hotel for the Dodge Rock and Roll marathon, which she would be running. The advantage of a host hotel is that a shuttle is provided to take runners to the start line at 4 or 5 AM,on race day, so were were willing to pay $180 a night for that safety feature. At check in, we were told, "no shuttle". Desk clerks were barely polite, forget welcoming. The hotel is very old, so the old-fashioned rooms were no surprise. The TV provided a laugh; it was a 12 inch box set.. The power on the TV went out several times, but it came back on when he hit the power button again. The TV remote was visibly dirty and had crud on it. I had to wash my hands each time I used it. The bathroom was dirty: the floor had visible water splash spots and was gritty with dirt. The bath tub had a ring of mold in the seams. The pedestal for the sink had a small dark splash of something that could be blood, but that would have been removed with even a cursory wiping... had any cleaning person bothered to do so. The bathtub shower set up had no hand holds with which to steady oneself getting in and out of the tub. I had to grab onto the shower curtain and pray I didn't slip. Before I could even take a shower, I had to call the front desk to send someone to get the shower working. It took two phone calls before someone finally showed up. The faucet was loose and corroded, and the pull knob that starts the shower wasn't working. Maintenance man was polite and professional, he had the strength to jiggle and pull that he got the shower running for me. He said the faucet assembly needed to be replaced and offered to come back later to do that. I asked how long it would take, and he said "it will take a while", so I declined. The bedding was clean and fresh, and the beds were comfortable. We were unable to use our laptop computer; in trying to connect to the hotel home page, we got the warning that it is a malware site. There were no vending machines anywhere. The only places within the hotel to eat are three pricey restaurants, but no little snack shop to get coffee or snacks. We ordered room service for lunch, The food came within the 30 minutes promised and was nicely presented and was very good. Cost for a chicken salad and rolls, and a chicken sandwich and soda was $40; that included service charge and gratuity. Server was polite and professional. The hotel was also hosting tryouts for "America's Got Talent" TV show, so the hotel lobby were crowded, loud, and chaotic. In fact every time we had to enter and exit through the lobby it was crowded, loud and chaotic. The entry to the hotel for vehicles is narrow and dark, so there is always a delay to wait for a cab or your car to be brought around, and a delay for the vehicles to be able to exit. The valets work hard and really hustle to get your car or cab and load your luggage. Given the poor conditions; they earn their tips. The only staff that was not courteous or friendly was the desk staff. At check in, she was curt and matter of fact. No pleasantry. At check out, he asked my name and kept his head down at the computer until he pushed a paper across the desk at me and said "there you go". I had to ask, "is this my receipt?" He only nodded yes. No "thank you", no "come again", nothing. If the lack of amenities, customer service and cleanliness is not important to you, and cost is irrelevant, then you will like this hotel. Incidentally, my daughter went downstairs on race day at 4:30 AM prepared to call a taxi, but fortunately she met up with two other runners with whom to walk the seven blocks to the start line.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: kgriff7978
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in..... When I arrived to my room it was gross there was hair in the sink hair, hair on the door, hair on the shower, trash in the closet. When I requested them to clean the room, I returned to the room and the window was left opened and there was a bag of opened candy on the night stand. (The Candy did not belong to me) So I don't know if someone entered my room or if housekeeping left a bag of opened candy on the night stand.. When I asked to talked to the manager I was told they were too busy.. At no point of my stay did I get to talk to a manager, because they were too busy. HORRIBLE customer service, HORRIBLE housekeeping. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaTrekker
Reviews.Content: This is a magnificent, ornate hotel built in the grand days of the early 20's and frequented by Hollywood's elite. The interior architecture is fantastic, yet it is plenty modern. The room was big enough and was comfortable with space enough to work, but it sure could have used a mini fridge. The in-hotel restaurant was a little pricey, but common for that area. I was there for a convention and the facilities were spectacular. Seeing the historical pictures on the wall of Oscar ceremonies and balls was pretty interesting. The hotel was convenient to the subway and many downtown venues and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Old and musty”
Reviews.Author: bikeskiplay
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business & had high expectations. Very disappointed. Yes, the common areas are nostalgic, love all the old photos. Service was mostly good. The room, however, was simply awful. I apparently was one of the unlucky ones who got a small room (heard others at my conference say that their rooms were huge). I wouldn't mind a small room if it was at least a little bit modernized--everything in this room was old. Stained draperies, old built-in wall units that appeared to have been repainted a dozen or so times, a circa 1980's tiny TV. And the bathroom.....Yikes!!! tiny and poorly laid out, moldy tiles, and so small that if the shower curtain is open slightly, the sink fills with water. Not kidding. The sink actually overlaps the tub enclosure. The bed is HARD. Had to sit in a conference all day after my first night, and my back was in spasm. As others have said, the health club is outdated and kind of nasty (although the womens' locker room was quite nice).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: ELK06
Reviews.Content: Very polite and attentive staff, prompt valet service, clean rooms. The business center offers free airplane boarding pass printing. Rooms are clean and beds are comfortable. The bathroom is a tad small, but it's not terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Beauty, but a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: Gr8Trades
Reviews.Content: This is a historic beauty in the middle of downtown LA. Valet parking is a must & costs an additional $40 a night. The lobby, first floor and ballrooms are part of Hollywood history and if you enjoy that, should not be missed. Beyond that, having reserved our room through the hotel on a "special" sale, we were very disappointed. Not dirty, but alot of maintenance issues in this tiny, interior room with zero view. OK, perhaps we got what we paid for, but this room should be shut down for a complete re-do! Disappointing for a hotel of such stature, under any conditions. We did not complain as we weren't in the room much. Nice to enjoy the history, but probably won't return.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance from the past, in the heart of downtown L.A.”
Reviews.Author: WahiawaFats
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Biltmore before, so knew about some of the grand, historic features of the design such as the wood-carved ceilings and grand staircases. On this visit, I was further reminded of the Biltmore's grand status when I wandered into the hallway with photographs of long-ago Academy Awards dinners in the hotel's ballroom. Then I kept walking and saw the fabulous basement swimming pool, with nearby steam room and spa pool. Even though we had to leave fairly early the next morning, my partner took the time to have a nice swim before we checked out. After all, it was only a one-block walk to the transit station, where we caught a quick train to Union Station, connected to the Fly-Away bus to LAX and hopped onto our plane for home. I also have to mention the friendly service from the door staff and the servers at Smeraldi's restaurant (our salads were unique and tasty, too). Sure, the windows are single-paned and let too much noise in from the street, but the room was large and well-appointed. I'll go back on my next trip, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in a beautiful, historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: ts19384
Reviews.Content: We spent the week-end in this hotel while visiting LA for the opening night of "Leap of Faith" - it is one of the beautiful, grand old dames. . . reminds me of the Memphis Peabody minus the ducks of course. Our room was large, well furnished, quiet and had a very comfortable bed. The location worked well for us - there is a metro stop within a couple of blocks - took metro to Union to express shuttle for a Dodger game. An unexpected pleasant surprise was that the hotel provided a courtesy car ride to the theatre (so ask if you are going to any of the performance venues). Hotel had a very affordable government rate - if you are retired military or other government employee. We also enjoyed the bar - open late (1 or 2 am) and serves food until 11pm. We did not eat in any of the restaurants - there are coffee shops and restaurants within walking distance. this will be my choice for any other LA stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this hotel - wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: djrbiz
Reviews.Content: After staying at many Marriotts, Hiltons and other chains, found this hotel to be a lovely, unique place with LOTS of atmosphere and the most important, friendly staff. As I spoke to most of the people we met who worked there, I was amazed at how many loyal, long term employees continue to happily work there. And it shows, from the moment we checked in, to the restaurant and housekeeping staff we met in the hall. The location is perfect, close to the Music Center and the downtown area that bustles with all kinds of people. We totally enjoyed ourselves and would definitely come back again. Thanks to the management for keeping a bit of the past for all to appreciate.

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to love this historic hotel...”
Reviews.Author: withkidstravel
Reviews.Content: I wanted to love this historic hotel. Gorgeous lobby, impressive public spaces overall. But the staff was going through the motions and the rooms.... I had two and both were bad. The first. Overlooking an internal airshaft, was so small that I had to turn sideways to walk from one small window past the be. Pretty worn down and grimy-feeling. Tub moldy and no cell phone reception. It really was a flophouse room with minor amenities. The next room was larger, less dingy, but still was pretty bad. Shower was a cool trickle, street noise loud, carpet was one you would never walk on barefoot. This hotel prompted me to get a flu shot the next day.

Reviews.Title: “All things considered, good value”
Reviews.Author: oahufrog
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's older but yes, it's historic - considering the rate I received I have no room to complain. While the property could use a building-wide renovation the history it holds is second-to-none.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laura L
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from an amazing road trip round California and spent 5 nights at the Biltmore downtown LA. After reading some mixed reviews on Tripadvisor I was not sure what to expect. It definitly exceeded my expectations! We arrived early evening and parked in the recommended Pershing Square undergound parking! This is much better than paying the $40 per night valet parking at the hotel. The car park has 24 hour security so did not feel nervous about leaving the car here and is only across the street. We parked on the 2nd level as the 1st is has mostly reserved spaces for a car hire company. You pay each time upon leaving the car park to a dude in a box so it''s better to stay out all day so you only have to pay once a day. The hotel lobby area is really beautiful and the staff were pleasent on check in. The room was clean and bed was comfortable. I agree with some reviews that the bathrooms are a bit aged and can do with an upgrade though this adds to the character of the hotel. I think with most hotels we stayed in during our adventure installing flat screen tv's, this was one thing missing from the room - we only had an old box thing. We only once ate the hotel via room service and was not that badly priced compared to some external restaurants we ate at. I think if I came back to LA I would stay more down the Hollywood end as there is not much to do round downtown. The first night was struggled to find somewhere to eat in the surrounding blocks but found a Wolfgang Puck in the end. Downtown is not a bustling city in the evening like London or New York and there are a lot of wierdos, homeless people hanging around Pershing Square though do not bother you unless you look like a complete tourist! It's not the type of place to walk around at night so better to drive to more populated parts of the city to eat and spend the evening! It's perfectly fine during the day as people are rushing around for work and seems to be a central work hub. Overall not a bad place to stay expecially for the price and as long as you have a car. There was no noise at night apart from the odd police car but you get that at home anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Better than my mild-set expectations”
Reviews.Author: nigelhedges
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Los Angeles, I stayed at the Millennium Biltmore Hotel LA for 3 nights. Like many travellers with limited intel, I made a decision based on the reviews from tripadvisor, and some independent research on the internet. My biggest concerns was noise levels, accessibility to LA, and quality of the room. From a noise perspective, it was fine for me. My room was located on the 6th floor around a corner from the lift however I did not get much sound from the corridors, and could only hear the lift beep if I stuck my ear against the front door. Which I only did once for testing! As to accessibility to LA, downtown was not very close to all the areas to LA and if I was staying longer than 3 nights I think I would have picked another location. However, as it was I spent most days doing 1 day tours (Universal Studios, Hollywood Homes, Santa Monica and Venice Beach, etc) and it was easy to take Starline tours from this hotel. Bare in mind you need to be there at 8:25am outside the hotel street (50metre walk from the undercover entrance of the hotel) for those tours. Which means you have about 50minutes of hotel hopping before you arrive at Starline to pay the balance of your tickets. There was a Macy's, a jewelry district, a few food places (Mexican for example) and several close convenience stores. Again, based on the purpose of the trip (really just a comfortable hotel to base myself for common tours), I couldn't fault it. There was also a irish pub a bit further down from South Grand Avenue (walk down hill and cross the road, look on your right). The last benchmark for me was the quality of the room. I thought it was above average but moderate to small. The room was a creamy yellow/white, and the carpet was clean but getting a little old. The housekeeping was efficient, never had any problems with fresh new towels (most days I had 3 sets), and bed was always neatly arranged. I slept well in the bed. Concierge and the bellhops were efficient but not "in-your-face" which I was glad about. One of them was James, who was very helpful during my stay. Helped me pick the more popular tours (which I later enjoyed). I only ate breakfast once at the hotel, but it was pleasant the 2 guys that attended my table were friendly and helpful about what was available. Frontdesk were also efficient, got smiles from most of them except one lady - but you always get one woman who really doesn't want to be working there. For me, it was not a big distraction compared to my overall pleasant result. Lastly, the place has a nice bar (bit noisy for my liking), and the ceilings were awesome with great detail. All in all, I would recommend this hotel, especially if you're there just for a few days and want something at a reasonable price (72hr special room rate - room only).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for the stars”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlyer082
Reviews.Content: This place is under rated. It is a gorgeous Hotel. Back in the day the Hotel was the location of the Oscar Awards. People like Walt Disney stayed there when travelling through. There is a mini museum in the hotel where you can see all the famous people who stayed there. We enjoyed our stay. In the foyer they had a computer with free internet access. It made life so much easier. There is a lovely restaurant which does an awesome buffet breakfast. The only negaive was that I thought it was a little dusy in our room (but not too bad). My husband didnt think so..but he is a guy.... ; ) We would stay here again.....

Reviews.Title: “Not so grand as it looks. You get what you paid for. but prepare for $$$ parking, but great location”
Reviews.Author: Lilmcnugget
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed at this LA hotel for 4 nights for our anniversary getaway. We booked it on expedia after checking out other travelers' advices and balancing out the price (at the time of booking this hotel was the only hotel in downtown that still remains affordable after the sales). This hotel has quite a character to it . Grand Hollywood classic. We took a peek at their ballroom, it is very nice and grand but yet still remain a characteristics vintage look to it. Checking in at the hotel, the hotel looks pretty grand on the outside. We were greeted by friendly , helpful staff at the front desk, going up to our room thru nicely decorated hallway with high vaulted ceiling. So far so good , pleasantly surprised. But then the surprise went downhill from there as we were looking for our room. Thru a long long hallway we finally located our room at the far far far end of the building. We entered with the key but to find ourselves in a small gloomy room with 2 doors - 1 of them is rm 772, our room. We were like "OK..what now". Upon opening the door, we've found ourselves in a rm of a reasonable size for a king sz bed rm. The bed is ok (very soft with no back support just like many other hotels). The carpet is so so (my hubby mentioned the carpet might has flea as he felts itchy after walking barefoot). The air conditioning was acceptably noisy but effectively cold. However the room does not have the amenity you usually find in even a lower grade hotel; there is no fridge/freezer, no internet (they charge you for a fee though at $11/night or something). It is quite disappointing. The most ridiculous find - the TV, a 15" tube projection, it is an antique - just like the hotel itself!! The washroom is very spacious, but I wish it has an exhaust fan, the toilet bowl is clean with no pee stain ring, and a fixture that provides enough counter space for the guests to spread their necessities. Parking - it is a HUGE problem. Upon arriving at the hotel (we flew in from Vancouver, rented a car at the airport), we were shocked to learn that the hotel offers valet parking for a whooping $44 overnight. You can find park it yourself for $16 /night at the Perishing Square underground parking across the street, or if you can walk for 1/2 a block, you can find it cheaper for $12/night at a public parking on Oliver Street. It is monitored, bright, well-lighted - many exotic cars tend to park there overnight, so security gotta be good. Location - in the heart of LA downtown. Close of transit and train station. Reasonably close to many LA attractions and highways. You don't have to waste much time getting to and from the highways.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning!”
Reviews.Author: charlieannepascoe
Reviews.Content: This hotel was stunning. Regal. Romantic. Beautiful. The staff however were not so stunning. Unfriendly and unhelpful. Not a good way to greet and treat paying customers.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: edwardsa406
Reviews.Content: Only stayed 2 nights but a gorgeous hotel. There wasn't much going on outside of the hotel but the hotel bar was great and staff really friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I Could Always Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Justineisu
Reviews.Content: I grew up in los angeles so I know the city well. As a young girl I remember the two most beautiful hotels iin town - The Biltmore and the Ambassador. I have stayed at the Biltmore at least 3 times in the last 6 months because of business in the area. I have always found its staff to be one of the best in the business. Here are some things that happened. The staff is grest and very accommodating. They are also full of knowledge as to how to get to certian areas - advised me once it would be easier to take the subway than try the bus or a cab. My rooms have always been clean and spacious and when I requested certain things I got it. There were never any problems. On my last stay something strange occurred. The desk clerk told me she was going to put me in a different style room and if I did not like it, to come back and they would change it. At first I was shocked. It was a family suite from the old days. You walked through the door and there were two doors. That room turned out to be large and very nice. I have just loved staying here.

Reviews.Title: “A must-stay in Downtown Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: Flight421
Reviews.Content: I love staying here. Always excellent service, the attendants at the front desk are always very welcoming and helpful, all staff members are warm and ready to assist - it's just an enjoyable, relaxing atmosphere. Upon entering it's like it's own little world, despite the fact that it's in a relatively busy area in Downtown LA. You could spend the whole weekend in the hotel and not get bored - multiple restaurants, shops, amenities - the dining can't be beat, and love that there is variety of tastes to choose from. The breakfast is divine - you can choose from the menu or select the buffet option. The rooms are very private and quiet, and the standard room for the inexpensive rate cannot be beat. You're able to stay in one of the nicest hotels in Downtown Los Angeles without breaking the bank - WIN! The Biltmore has several locations for dining, all different types of cuisine: La Bistecca has exquisite dinner entrees and desserts. The servers are welcoming, polite, and on top of their game. I never had to ask for anything - they were always two steps ahead of me. Smeraldi's Restaurant has an excellent breakfast menu and an excellent breakfast buffet. The servers are here are also run the restaurant well. Dinner at Sai Sai was another excellent experience. The food is cooked just right, preparation was rather quick, and the display was one of a kind - one of the best dining experiences I've had for Asian cuisine. The lounge connected to the lobby has a full bar, menu, and sitting area where you can just relax with cocktails. I went on a Friday evening once and there was live Jazz til 2 AM. The cocktails were delicious, and with complimentary bar snacks. If you're looking to visit the Biltmore but don't plan to stay, visiting one of the restaurants or the lounge is worth the visit alone. Whether you're a visitor to town or a local, you must experience the Millennium Biltmore stay - it is heaven. A way to get away without going too far :)

Reviews.Title: “very classy oldfashioned hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kortenbergtraveler
Reviews.Content: after reading some negative comments here lately on this lovely oldfashioned and stylish hotel, I feel obliged to react, be it already one year after our stay in this place. this is an old grand luxurious hotel, well maintained, a real 5 star hotel, and with honest people working there : the valet parking is so expensive but they immediately guided me to the cheap overnight parking rate of around 15 usd in the underground parking opposite the hotel which is very easy to find; we paid only 76 euro for the night for two adults and two children via british airways and loved the wonderfull decor; all was nice and clean, and my children loved to see that a movieset for CSI NY (yes, in LA ... ) was filming there the next day ; we will try and go back this end of August and hope this time no filmcrew will block the pool entrance ...

Reviews.Title: “COULD NOT HAVE BEEN HAPPIER!”
Reviews.Author: kellyalst
Reviews.Content: My husabdn and I stayed at this hotel in August 2009. I have found some reveiws on this hotel to be unbeliable as we could not fault this hotel, it's location or staff. It is grand, beautiful and spacious. The resturant downstairs is fantastic, I had the best meal of my life in it and can not wait to go back. We were so impressed with our stay that I have booked this hotel again for this October.

Reviews.Title: “Not as grand as one expected”
Reviews.Author: Raj80_2010
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed with this hotel, the photos online appealed to us, looking grand and spacious. Unfortunately I found the bedrooms to be dark and dated. We stayed in room 845 and found it smelt of stale cigarettes. I asked housekeeping for room spray but it did not make much difference. The facilities are good, with a swimming pool, gym, steam and sauna room. But I do like bedrooms to have clean carpets. There was also only one mirror in the bedroom, but the lighting was awful to see what you were doing!

Reviews.Title: “Feeling like ending it all? Then room 480 is for you ..............”
Reviews.Author: damenaomineufeld
Reviews.Content: Depressed, fed up and feeling like ending it all? You could do no better than Room 480 in the Millenium Biltmore Hotel; the perfect room to end everything. Walk along the depressing dark cream corridors with its old busy patterned carpet, and open the door of Room 480 and the first thing you will notice is the filthy light switch; so old that it is now a grim darkish yellow in colour. The room itself appears clean, but it's SO depressing and in bad need of being brought up into this century. More dark cream dingy walls and dark, dated patterned carpet decor. I don't know about you, but the first thing I do whenever I walk into a hotel room is look out of the window at the view, which, bearing in mind one was in a big city like L.A., didn't seem too bad. For some strange reason the sash window was covered in chicken wire on the outside, eventhough I was on the fourth floor. I undid the lock and tried to open the window but it was stuck rigid, and when I removed my hands they were black with dirt from the window top which had obviously not been cleaned or dusted in a very long time. Very frustating as I hate having to use air conditioning. The bathroom and bedroom basics were clean, but lurking in the corner of the bedroom was a vile faded armchair which I had no intention of using during my stay there. Even the dark cream shelves for one's clothing were old, scratched and uninviting, and made me feel that I didn't really want my clothing to touch the surfaces. In conclusion, a truly ghastly room. I should mention, however, that the hotel staff are very pleasant and helpful, but I still hope that I never am sent to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Historic Hotel, Oozing with Nostalgia”
Reviews.Author: cherokeechick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love to travel by train and when doing so we make a point to stay in vintage old nostalgic hotels as part of the experience. We found the Biltmore to be perfect! I could feel Old Hollywood in every room. The hotel is opulent and grand. The lobby area and downstairs must be seen to be believed. Opulent molding, painted ceilings, carved wood, flower, fountains...just amazing. Our room was beautiful. Lots of room and a comfortable bed. I especially liked the old curved-edge bathtub and glass handle on the door. We have stayed in the old "Grand Dame" hotels in most major cities and the Biltmore is among our top five. Folks who want modern convenience and 21st century amenities should realize that older nostalgic hotels may not be what they are looking for, but for those of us in middle age who love history and the early 20th century experience the Biltmore is fantastic. I whole-heartedly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel what a piece of Movie history”
Reviews.Author: lizearl3
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was beautiful and the staff were great they could'nt do enough to make you feel welcome. The room was spotless and very big maid service everday and turndown at night two tiny things would be the price of food in the restaurants in the hotel and the street noise but it is not that bad that you can't sleep.The area around the hotel with Pershing Square was just full of homeless people day and night, it is very sad to see this but they never bothered you, but with all the wealth in that city they shold look after them a little better. Back to the hotel, before we went i had read reviews giving out about the staff and the state of the hotel well i certainly could not fault them.Joseph,Elisa and John the cocierge team so helpful and pleasant

Reviews.Title: “Downtown hotel in sore need of updating”
Reviews.Author: Albiani
Reviews.Content: There are a few good things to note about this hotel, but please be warned they do not off-set the fundamental problems / issues I had with this property and I would discourage any friend or peer from booking this property. First the positives - 1) Good downtown location for business 2) Cheap rate ($125/ night) 3) Beautiful lobby and first floor that is reminscent of Hollywood's golden age. Despite these positive attributes this was easily the most frustrating place I've stayed in recent memory and I would highly recommend travellers to look elsewhere until the hotel rooms are completely remodelled. While the hotel rooms were ample in size the same could not be said for the shoe-box sized bathroom, which was easily the worst I've been in recent memory. Privacy was also an issue. I could clearly hear conversations from both rooms on either side of my room. Every single word that was spoken I could hear without straining my hearing in the least. Lastly (and what turned out to be the real deal breaker for me) was the terrible workspace set up and the hotel's incredibly slow and unreliable internet connection which left me unable to work from my hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: STVVEE
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a Saturday night at the hotel recently for our 18th wedding anniversary! What a great time. From the Valet, to check-in, to the cocktail lounge, to dinner and breakfast, we had nothing but excellent service and a great time. We stayed in a king room with a minimal view, but just the thought of the hotel's history and who may have stayed in that room in the past was good enough for us. The service and drinks in the cocktail lounge were excellent! We had dinner at La Bisteca. They transformed the original lobby of the hotel into a beautiful dining room. We ordered the grilled calimari to start. It was huge and amazing! Our waiter was excellent and recommended the steaks. We both agree that it was probably the best steak we have ever had. I had a rib eye that was seasoned and cooked perfectly! My wife's filet was the same! The only negative I have is that the cocktail I was drinking, The Big Apple, cost twice as much in the cocktail lounge as it did in the restaraunt! But was worth the money in both instances! The breakfast buffet was just as pleasureble in the morning! A great time and a wonderful weekend getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Ambience”
Reviews.Author: RoshiniKS
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel. It was our first time to this hotel. The lobby was simply majestic. We were upgraded to a Suite-type room - which was just great specially when you have two children with you. The room was way too spacious...... Located in downtown LA with great restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “My sister and I took our daughters to the...”
Reviews.Author: pdx2sdcw
Reviews.Content: My sister and I took our daughters to the Biltmore for one of the kid's 13th birthday. My sister had been married there 20 years ago and wanted to bring her daughter back to show it off. And indeed the public spaces are fantastic. My recommendation is to drop in, have tea and leave.  Our room was reminiscent of Willy Wonka's office and not in a charming way. Furniture had been added and subtracted over the years and the pictures still hung in their original positions. I'm not an overwhelmingly aethetic person, but that is a jangling experience. The second room of our suite was huge, sparcely decorated and like the first room, sadly worn. My impression: the hotel has fallen on hard times and corners were being cut all around. Ratty carpets, dirty windows sitting in shabby casings, showers with bad mildew. Confirming my impressions came at checkout when I told the front desk that room service had substituted a bottle of rose for a "comparable" bottle with my permission. What arrived was an undrinkable white Zinfandel. I put the entire bottle back outside my room.  Front desk gave me a, "Well, what do you know about that" look and told me I SHOULD HAVE TAKEN IT UP WITH ROOM SERVICE. You know, because the front desk has nothing to do with that stuff. They saved the $5 wholesale they paid for that wine and lost a customer for life. Do make time to see the public spaces at the Biltmore but don't bother spending the night with them.

Reviews.Title: “Looks, location and lobby were great -- room was another story.”
Reviews.Author: Schiltkraut
Reviews.Content: The ground floor surroundings were impressive. The staff was helpful and attentive. But the bar was more than a bit pricey, charging me $15 for a generic bourbon Manhattan. The room, however, would have been more appropriate for a hotel called the Millennium Bilgewater. The bathtub was chipped and worn, the drain was so slow that one stood in ankle deep water while showering. The tile grout on the tub walls sported an ample growth of mold and mildew. For the prices charged at this place, the room was a sorry piece of work. I suspect that if I had complained to the front desk, I might have gotten another room. The problem is, one should not have to complain in order to get a decent room in the first place. Once you leave the opulence of the ground floor and lobby areas, what you find is a tired, old establishment in dire need of some maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “gREAT HOTEL , GREAT PRICE, GOOD LOCATION..SAFE”
Reviews.Author: SWDETROITGIRL
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very beautiful. Great location..not far from Dodger Stadium where we went to root for the Detroit Tigers!! Safe location, whic i was concerned about when I looked for rooms. There was a prom goin on, but wasn't noisey at all. Lil jazz bar downstairs, had a drink called "balck Dalia"(sp?) Gross!! tasted like Jager and cough syrup with a hint od orange...lol..BUt besides that , room was great, area was great..parking is way over priced!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but VERY noisy.”
Reviews.Author: CTS80
Reviews.Content: I wanted to love this hotel. The staff was great upon check-in and the hotel is just beautiful. I love historic places. The room was huge, though it could stand to be updated a bit. I was willing to overlook all of this because the historic details. However, by midnight I was ready to leave. I was traveling alone with my infant son. We both went to sleep early and were awakened constantly between the hours of 10pm-2am. People in the hallway, staff members, random people, etc. The walls were so thin that it sounded like people were right in our room. Yikes. Stay elsewhere and just come over to admire the architecture in the hotel. I am not overly picky, but I won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “For an older crowd”
Reviews.Author: trick15
Reviews.Content: The rooms were good...The bathroom was very tight, though there are many different room layouts. The hotel was more geared towards older travelers as well as groups. Room service was great...as well as bar was a nice area to relax for a bit. Had to pay for internet which i had to hook up with a cable. Cell phone service in the hotel was a min...but of course that is our carriers issue, but was hard to make and get calls for work.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: zpcsc
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before booking this hotel & I hoped to get it through Priceline, which I did. I was very excited but the only concern was several reviews I read about the beds not being very comfortable, but mine sure was comfy! The hotel is located 2 blocks from the subway, which I took on my way in & out. When I arrived it was much earlier than check in but I was in a hurry to make the conference that I was attending. The person at the check in was very polite & to my amaze gave me my room right away! I have never gotten a room before 2pm anywhere...I had requested a courtyard room, way away from smoking floors & a king size bed. Well all my requests were made. My room was great, roomy, comfy beds, nice tv, etc. When I went back downstairs & asked how to get to the JW Marriott about 1 mile away, the concierge suggested I take the towncar that the hotel offered. So I thought that was very nice. My conference ended late 9:30pm, & it was cold. So I called the hotel again & they were nice enough to pick me up (the drivers are very polite). They picked me up the days that I stayed late, while I walked in the mornings or took the Dash bus for only 0.25 cents. Internet was $9.95 a day, but I heard someone say that other hotels were $14.00 a day. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Concierge, great location”
Reviews.Author: 101Teacher
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great place to stay in LA, easy to get to and easy to get everywhere on the red line for public transport. The thing we loved was a great bar around the corner called Casa... great Sangria & great service. The Hotel itself we avoided staying in... the Concierge was pretentious and unhelpful unless he could see profit in it for himself, and the bar staff did not seem happy to have customers. Reception VERY casual, even for an Aussie. The pool is a great feature, like swimming in a roman bath. Good opening hours too. Some language issues with the staff... our bath was missing a plug so they sent up some ear plugs! among other things. Long walk for ice, however nice to stay in a place that has some character which this Hotel has in buckets. Beautiful hotel.... staff just need some training. Probably more for business than leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel! Much better than a generic Holiday Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Prettyinpink850
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I stayed here for four nights in March. The hotel is beautiful, charming and elegant. The rooms are quite understated in comparison to the rest of the hotel but clean, and adequate for what you need. Hot water, powerful shower, incredibly comfy bed. The location is great for getting around L.A, we didn't have a car and took the metro bus or underground. We were worried because a lot of people had told us that you need a car to get around L.A but we coped just fine without and enjoyed seeing people go about their daily commute and got a real feel for the city. There are bus stops on every corner outside the hotel and the underground train station is across the street, you can get to Hollywood in about 20 mins and one day we took the bus to Anaheim to go to Disneyland. There are also plenty of coffeeshops and shops about for convenience. Also the swimming pool is great, a real Art deco feel and great hot tub to relax in after a day of sightseeing. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A non-chain, refreshing step back in time!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTexan83
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an absolute gem! I was traveling on business with co-workers and we all LOVED it! If you need to stay in the downtown area, this is your only option! But I wouldn’t exclude it if you consider yourself a “tourist” either. We were total tourists the whole time. It is just such a charming place full of character. We had a wonderful 5 night stay and we were so glad that we didn’t go with a more modern, contemporary chain. This hotel is breathtakingly beautiful and the details of its design truly take you back in time. It was opened in the 1920s and it’s where they used to hold the Oscars in the 30s and some of the 40s…it’s actually where the Oscars were created and where Shirley Temple won Best Actress. There is so much history and background to it and you can totally feel the history as you walk around and see all of the old photos. It’s like you are back in Hollywood’s Golden Era. And we loved the location; very close to LA Live and within walking distance to plenty of local restaurants and fun bars. Other reviews mention that downtown is a “ghost town” after business hours, but we had a great time when we went out there. And we had no trouble at all getting out to the beach and to Hollywood to see things there. I guess because it is so old, the AC wasn’t the best. But it wasn’t enough to be a big deal. It was just that the housekeepers would turn it off to save energy during the day, so it was warm when I came back in the evening. And the staff was awesome! There was one male bartender we didn’t care for, but we all have wonderful things to say about the rest of the staff. We didn’t have a single bad thing to say about our stay after we left. If you are brave, you can ask the bar staff about the many ghost stories they have there! But if you are like me and your imagination likes to take over…I don’t recommend it! It was a little eerie at times, but still definitely worth the experience!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home. Elegant, Welcoming and full of Charm”
Reviews.Author: jayneym
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our first stop on our trip from Australia and we were very tired after our long journey. The doorman and reception staff were both efficient and friendly and were able to have us comfortably in our room (with luggage) within 15 mins of stepping out of the limo. The room was very comfortable with lovely beds and plenty of space for living with a 10 year old. All staff were most accommodating and whilst the hotel is old, this only ads to its charm and glamourous history. Location is great and the food at Sai Sai (in house restaurant) was simply stunning.Whilst earplugs were provided - we did not need them at all and had a lovely quiet stay for our complete 4 nights. Would definately recommend this glamourous hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Aweful”
Reviews.Author: mokshad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is aweful. 1) The hotel is under renovation: Which nobody mentioned upon making a reservation or check in. 2) The staff were deceitful in nature. When I reserved at the desk they mentioned nothing about no hot water. BUT wait, as soon as they swipe my credit card and I sign, The employee goes "Oh, just so you know there is no hot water". 3) Its so dead/haunted that when I went up to the 6th floor for the vending machine. It was plugged off with a pile of rust and dirt all over it. 4) As soon as I used the shower there was a massive pile of dust. Suggesting that either no one has used the room for weeks or there actually isn't any sanitary measures being taken with filtering water. This hotel is way past its' good days. No wonder the hotel is so cheap Thank You

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to be”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler2008a
Reviews.Content: Went to LA for a conference. Was very happy with the staff. The room was very nice. I used the business center and the fitness center. The food was excellent and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very luxurious, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: storey917
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this downtown LA hotel for 4 nights. I usually go for something a little more basic but got this on a special rate at Expedia. The pictures of this hotel speak for themselves - very elegant and sumptuous with a traditional feel to it. Although the hotel's decor could be described as old fashioned, it is not old i.e. I did not feel that my room or the public areas of the hotel were in need of redecoration in anyway. I was on the 11th floor and I found my room to be very quiet and clean. The service was excellent but I would describe it as professional, rather than friendly. The hotel is handily located for downtown LA with easy public transport links to Hollywood and Santa Monica. However, I do not feel I would have been comfortable walking in this area on my own at night.

Reviews.Title: “I would only stay again if it was the only option available”
Reviews.Author: BeeLee92
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it had great rates and a 4 star rating. We got to the hotel on our first night to find a hooker walking around the lobby, after we went to our room and got settled we walked down to the lobby again to look around and found 2 more hookers! I was honestly disgusted, these women were being very obvious and the hotel hadn't done anything to send them away. After we went back to our room, we settled down and went to sleep, only to hear the blaring TV of the room next to us and the loud traffic. Thank GOD the hotel gives complimentary ear-plugs because we sure used them. The next night seemed to be the opposite, they had a worker walking around the corridor where the hookers were and the street traffic seemed to be much quieter so we were able to sleep. It was very odd to see the two extremes. There were many downsides to this hotel, but I did enjoy it as well. They have a computer in the lobby that you can use so you don't have to pay for internet, there is a printer there as well. The men who run the parking lot are very nice, and so are most of the other workers. I was just walking around one afternoon and I was treated to a free Shirley Temple by one of the cafe workers - Did you know she stayed in this hotel?? The pool was an experience, so pretty, it is truly a 1920's experience. We ended up cutting our stay a night short because of some issues and the staff was nice about checking us out early. As for the rooms, The TVs are horrible, straight out of the 1980s, the bathtub had a leak, our door wouldn't open the entire way, the staff keeps the rooms very clean otherwise, dirt was never an issue. Honestly, I don't think I would stay there again, it was far too noisy. The location of the hotel is nice though, its a mile away from the staples center, and a 10 minute taxi ride to Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Holiday, first time to LA”
Reviews.Author: Jensenlover23
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing they were friendly and kind when she first checked-in and my dad wanted an upgrade. My dad used for a rollar way bed for my sister and we had an amazing view from our window. The room was amazing the TV the resturant had the best food ever. The location was in the heart of Los Angeles we had to board the Metro to get to the Hollywood Highland and Universal City anyway the whole trip to LA first time

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: CatsMeowPhoenix
Reviews.Content: After months of researching affordable, decent hotels I decided on this one. Some of the reviews were negative and I will admit, they almost swayed me to look elsewhere. I decided on this one afterall because of the smokin' deal I got. I booked through Travelocity about a month and a half in advance and paid fifty/night. That's unheard of in L.A., even sketchy parts of L.A. (which is most of L.A.). My friend and I drove in from Phoenix for a TV show taping and we stayed two nights. The hotel is in the middle of downtown L.A. It's the ideal location for a business traveler. Upon arrival, we were forced to circle the block to get to the entrance because the valet entrance was coned off (just during morning/evening rush hours). We were immediately greeted by the friendly valet. Check in was simple. The hotel is as majestic as it seems. For all of the patrons who complain of it being old, it is old! It's historic! But, it's well maintained. I booked a double standard room. However, when we got to the room, it was a double suite! No one mentioned an upgrade and I forgot to ask! The beds were small (but I'm used to a Queen) and kind of hard but it's all personal preference. No bedbugs, as I've read from some reviews. It was very clean. The bathroom is small but sufficient. The water pressure was amazing (some reviews show it to be weak). We had a fabulous room. We were at the end of a long hall, our room facing another part of the building. We had zero outside noise. We were on the 4th floor. We never heard anyone. The vending machine is expensive (bring your own drinks) and I never saw an ice machine but I'm sure they have at least one! One night we walked a few blocks to an IHOP to eat and it appeared safe. The area is surrounded with chic, city living apartment buildings. Around the corner from the IHOP was a Ralph's grocery store which was convenient. Traveling into Hollywood took about 15 minutes, depending on traffic (which is NEVER predictable). Valet was forty four dollars/night but it's really the most convenient way to park because you have in/out privileges. I never saw the public parking & even then there's a fee and no in/out privileges. We had our own car so I didn't pay close attention so I don't know if I saw public transportation. Keep in mind this is downtown and it's busy during week days and weekend days. Lots of pedestrians, that move at their own pace (at crosswalks). But, I noticed this is the norm in L.A. So, overall, a trip to L.A. requires patience! We only saw probably 1/4 of the hotel and it was amazing. If I could get an awesome deal again, I'd stay there every time. Take away points- For the budget conscious, there is no free parking, no free breakfast, no fridge/microwave, no in room safe. But, it does include a iron/ironing board, a typical hotel hair blow dryer (I bring my own but my friend tried to use theirs and it died on her), non-labeled toiletries and a small TV (who really goes to watch TV?). There is a fun little jazz bar on the first floor that looked fun.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, staff not friendly and hotel stench was terrible. NOT RECOMMEND!”
Reviews.Author: blaquerose
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the hotel around midnight, one person was working. The entrance to the hotel is really nice and takes your breath away. We told the clerk that we wanted a non smoking room but we ended up on a smoking floor anyways. We tried to switch rooms but he gave us 101 excuses why he couldn't switch us without charging extra. The hallways were dirty, the paint on the walls were chipped, the red carpets smell like cigarette and mold. It also appears that the day staff were much nicer then the evening staff. The kitchen closed early so we had to go to another hotel down the street to get some food. For the amount we paid for staying at this hotel, it is not worth it. They are far more better hotels in the area. The good thing was that the train station was across the street and it was a 15 minute ride to hollywood/highland. We only changed and slept in hotel, stayed out from sun up to sun down.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful majestic hotel, would stay again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: luxurycars
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and some friends took a trip to LA and stayed at this hotel. It was quite lovely, well kept, very old Hollywood, I believe the Academy Awards was held here back in the day. Our room was comfortable and nice, staff was great, valet was very polite (yes there is a daily valet fee, there is no self park, this is California be prepared to pay for parking.) Also, we all ate at their restaurant, is was very yummy too. Nothing bad to say, not sure why it has negative reviews, would stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gateway to downtown with Private Health Club!”
Reviews.Author: NorcalBeyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Biltmore with kids (4 & 6) after a trip to Disneyland in order to check out downtown and hit Koreatown (a must!). It turned out really great! We saw film crews at the hotel, and really enjoyed the pool, steam room, hot tub & sauna. It felt like a private health club! Exploring Grand Central Market and taking the Angel's flight train were other fun activities. Overall the hotel experience was good, but definitely self park in the Pershing square garage ($16 versus $40 for valet). We would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately, the reviews are right...”
Reviews.Author: TrnrMom
Reviews.Content: I was concerned when this hotel came up on Priceline - we usually get the Marriott since I had read the reviews about noisy rooms, but I've never had trouble sleeping with my sound canceling ear buds.....until now. Pros: Beautiful, historic public areas, friendly service, for the most part, exceptions noted below. Room safes, walk in closets, nice architectural details in rooms, comfortable bed. Good rate on Priceline. Cons: 1) Generator noise that can be heard in the corridor of the 3rd floor, nearest the courtyard. It got worse when the bathroom light/fan were turned on, and when the air conditioner was turned on. Management should not be renting rooms, in which it is impossible to sleep. We asked to be moved the next morning & no questions were asked as to why - they already knew why. 2) Second room on 3rd floor over alleyway, had barely audible hum, and street sounds...until bathroom light or airconditioner was turned on. Street sounds were louder in this room, but one expects that in a big city. 3) Thin walls - one can hear your neighbors & housekeeping (especially when they stand & talk in front of your door for 5 minutes) 4) Parking is $40 - park at Pershing Square for $15 if you don't need to go in/out 5) Restaurant was good, but a bit on high side 6) Valet forgot about me for 10 minutes, after unloading our car. 7) Husband complained about small, out of focus TV. 8) Inadequate bathroom shelf space for more than one person. 9) Crowded, outdated, stuffy fitness room. Don't know what to recommend if you use Hotwire or Priceline - usually bidding on 3 1/2 stars gives you the downtown Marriott - bid on 4 star hotels to be safe? I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: criseyde
Reviews.Content: I travel two weeks out of every month and most of the travel time is spent in L.A.., generally in four+ star hotels. The Biltmore is quite beautiful with a stunning lobby and many lovely restaurants. The staff is also extremely helpful. The rooms have high ceilings, intricate details....Very period L.A. The only negative is that the rooms could use some updating. In general, though, the hotel has a lot of character and historical interest that one couldn't find in the Westin, for example. Definitely worth a trip. I would highly recommend the hotel to Europeans and anyone who is interested in a unique, beautiful, old hotel. I will return!

Reviews.Title: “downtown LA location, magnificent lobby, older rooms”
Reviews.Author: sputnik013
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent business traveler and usually stay at Marriott or Doubletree hotels. I needed to stay downtown LA and was looking for an alternative to those hotels due to cost. This hotel has a prime downtown location, a magnificent, beautiful and elegant lobby, but is an older hotel. Rooms were clean, but room and bathroom fixtures were worn out. Beds were good with duvet covers and there were all of the usual amenities in the bath (soaps, hairdryers, etc) but the ceramic tiles were cracked, and repairs looked amateurish in the bath (exposed bolts, caulking, etc). My room was very quiet, but I specifically requested an inside courtyard room. When I checked in there was actually another couple complaining about room noise from a cracked window and was asking to move to another room. My room was very quiet and you would never know I was downtown. The staff was very professional and courteous. Parking for the hotel is a ridiculous $50 valet only, but you can very easily park across the street at the Pershing Square garage for under $15 a night. I ordered room service and it was prompt and hot - cost was reasonable for what I usually expect for room service - vegetarian pasta and soup for under $25 total including tip. There are several restaurants on property, but looking at the menus appeared very pricey, although I did not eat there. Overall I would recommend this hotel as an inexpensive downtown alternative if you don't mind the older amenities and you manage to get a courtyard facing room. The lobby is an awesome place to meet people. Simply beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad; could have been much better”
Reviews.Author: Budget_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via Hotwire at a really good price for an upscale downtown L.A. hotel. Had I paid full price I'd have been REALLY disappointed. But for the price I paid, the room was better than adequate, but the stay could have been--should have been--a lot better. After reading the reviews on this site, I requested a courtyard room so I didn't have to listen to traffic or hollering homeless. There was no outside noise. Day one, I heard someone next door cough all night. Day two was blessedly quiet. Day three, I could hear the woman next door talking on the phone. I'm guessing she was on the phone since the only voice was hers and it's been quiet since. Good: **MB public areas are beautiful. **I arrived before check-in time and the gal at the desk checked me right in. **Bathroom clean Neutral: **Really hard bed (almost too hard for me and I like a firm bed) but could be a negative for someone who likes a softer bed. **Bathroom / sleeping area long and very narrow, normal for an older or downtown hotel.
